title: Gerardo Seoane
text:
Gerardo Seoane Castro (born 30 October 1978) also known as Gerry Seoane, is a Swiss professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> coach and former player who is currently the head coach of <a href="Bayer%2004%20Leverkusen">Bayer Leverkusen</a>.
Managerial career.
Seoane was appointed manager of reigning <a href="Swiss%20Super%20League">Swiss Super League</a> champions <a href="BSC%20Young%20Boys">Young Boys</a> on 2 June 2018. Seoane, aged 39, was considered a surprise pick to succeed <a href="Adi%20H%C3%BCtter">Adi Hütter</a> as coach, despite guiding <a href="FC%20Luzern">FC Luzern</a> to third place in the <a href="2017%E2%80%9318%20Swiss%20Super%20League">Super League</a> in his first full management job. Upon taking the role as Young Boys manager, Seoane pledged to continue with Hütter's playing style and keep the backroom staff in place.
In his first season in charge, he guided the club to their 13th league title and helped the club qualify to the <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20UEFA%20Champions%20League%20group%20stage">group stage</a> of the <a href="UEFA%20Champions%20League">UEFA Champions League</a> for the first time in club history. In his second season, Seaone led the club to a domestic double, delivering their 14th league title (their third in a row) and seventh cup title and first in over 30 years.
Seoane will manage <a href="Bundesliga">Bundesliga</a> club <a href="Bayer%2004%20Leverkusen">Bayer Leverkusen</a> starting from the 2021–22 season.
Personal life.
Seoane was born in <a href="Lucerne">Luzern</a>, Switzerland to <a href="Galicia%20%28Spain%29">Galician</a> parents and holds both Swiss and Spanish citizenship. In addition to German, he is also fluent in Spanish, English, French, Italian and Portuguese.
